revised_title: Stability of Thin Strip Material under Shearing Forces: Tests and Findings
tldr: The authors conducted tests on thin sheet metal to determine the stability of materials under shearing forces. They found that the "per cent. proof load" was not a reliable indicator of a material's suitability for use in aeroplane wing spars. Instead, they proposed using properties in compression as criteria for evaluating materials, as they are in the case of straight struts.
